summary: Form F-1 is used by foreign private issuers to register securities under the Securities Act of 1933, unless another form is specified. It cannot be used for asset-backed securities. If a majority-owned subsidiary does not meet eligibility, it can still use Form F-1 if the parent company guarantees the securities and meets the requirements.
